content:
Here is the cleaned up text:

Modifying OmniScript UI Behavior

Behavior options include:

* Hiding or showing elements and errors conditionally
* Hiding Next and Previous buttons
* Triggering events

Configuring the Cancel Link in an OmniScript

The Cancel link appears on every Step in an OmniScript. You can specify its behavior with the Cancel Type and Cancel Source.

Use the Conditional View Property to Conditionally Display Elements

Every step, block, or element supports at least one Conditional View. This allows you to hide elements based on conditions.

Hide OmniScript Elements

You can hide elements and child elements using the Hide property.

Hide the Next and Previous Buttons

You can hide a Step's Next and Previous buttons when using auto-advance options.

Customize OmniScript Error Messages

The error message handler enables you to replace default error messages with user-friendly ones when errors occur in OmniScript.

Display Messages in OmniScripts

You can display comments, requirements, success, and warning messaging based on validation expressions.

Enable Confirmation Prompts on Angular OmniScripts

You can enable confirmation prompts for Angular OmniScript actions.

Fire Platform Events from OmniScripts

You can fire Salesforce platform events from within an OmniScript.

Set Errors In an OmniScript

You can put error or validation messaging on elements in previous steps based on conditions from future steps using the Set Errors action element.

Triggering Lightning Events in OmniScript

You can trigger Lightning events from within an OmniScript.
title: Modifying OmniScript UI Behavior
